entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Hangs on to $29,000 Level, Despite Increased Market Volatility
entry.summary:
Bitcoin remained above a key support point on Friday, despite bears attempting to push the price below $29,000. Today‚Äôs session saw sentiment once again shift bearish, as U.S. consumer sentiment data looms. Ethereum was mostly unchanged in today‚Äôs session.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) continued to trade above the $29,000 mark on Friday, despite bearish pressure intensifying in today‚Äôs session.
After hitting a high of $29,520.71 on Thursday, BTC/USD dropped to an intraday low of $29,099.35 earlier in the day.
The move saw bitcoin briefly fall below a support point at $29,200, however prices have since climbed back above this point.
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
This latest slippage comes as the 10-day (red) moving average continued its downward cross versus its 25-day (blue) counterpart.
In addition to this, the relative strength index (RSI) neared a breakout below a floor at 41.00, however it has so far avoided this.
Should this take place, the next possible destination for BTC could be $28,000.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) traded above its own support point at $1,850 on Friday, as the cryptocurrency continued consolidating.
ETH/USD dropped to a bottom at $1,855.32 earlier in today‚Äôs session, a day after peaking at $1,878.43.
The price consolidation comes as the RSI failed to move above a current resistance level at 48.00.
Ethereum chart by TradingView
As of writing, the index is on the cusp of crossing this line, however momentum is still relatively weak.
There could likely be a spark later in the day, depending on how traders react to the University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment report.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect ethereum to drop below $1,800 this weekend? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: What is Fiat Money? History, Pros & Cons
entry.summary: Introduction Defining Fiat Money Fiat money is tender not backed by a tangible asset or commodity like gold or silver. It‚Äôs usually mandated by governments, but this isn‚Äôt always the case. The currencies we use for everyday transactions in the modern era are all examples of fiat money, such as the U.S. dollar (USD), the euro (EUR), the pound (GBP) or the Chinese Yuan (CNY). The term ‚Äúfiat‚Äù is a Latin word that means ‚Äúby decree‚Äù or ‚Äúlet it be done,‚Äù representing an arbitrary order that reflects the issuance of money as a government enactment. Fiat is one form of money, along with representative and commodity money. While fiat money comes in various forms ‚Äî physical banknotes, coins or digital units ‚Äî representative money merely ‚Äúrepresents‚Äù an intent to pay, like a cheque. Commodity money h‚Ä¶

entry.title: If Bitcoiners Don‚Äôt Do More, CBDCs Will Win
entry.summary:
This is an opinion editorial by Logan Chipkin, a professional writer who creates educational content about Bitcoin and other topics. In ‚ÄúThe Fiat Standard,‚Äù economist Saifedean Ammous argues at length that the United States federal government has been propagandizing the masses into choosing ‚Äúcheap industrial substitutes‚Äù and ‚Äúmassively reducing (its) meat consumption‚Äù since at least 1916. As Ammous wrote:
‚Äú...the ADA (American Dietetics Association) is responsible for formulating the dietary guidelines taught at most nutrition and medical schools worldwide, meaning it has for a century shaped the way nutritionists and doctors (mis)understand nutrition. The astonishing consequence is that the vast majority of people, nutritionists, and doctors today think that animal fat is harmful, while‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance Withdraws Its Crypto License Application in Germany
entry.summary:
The world‚Äôs largest exchange for digital assets, Binance, has withdrawn its application for a German crypto custody license. The trading platform made it clear it‚Äôs not giving up on plans to eventually obtain authorization from the Federal Republic but wants its submission to better reflect the changing market and regulatory conditions.
Crypto Exchange Binance to Reconsider Attempt at Getting German Regulatory Approval
Binance, the leading cryptocurrency exchange by daily trading volume, has pulled out its application for a crypto license in Germany, Reuters reported, noting that the exchange is obviously rethinking its expansion plans in the current difficult regulatory environment.
The move comes after about a month ago the German financial news magazine Finance Forward revealed, c‚Ä¶

entry.title: Report Shows Only 5% Of VC-Backed Crypto Firms Developed A Market-Fit Product
entry.summary:
The crypto market was red hot in 2021, with venture capital firms pouring money into new projects at an astonishing rate. The particular rise of smart contracts and decentralized finance (DeFi) gave rise to a new band of companies looking to enter the crypto industry, even before fully understanding the nooks and crannies of the industry.¬†
However, just two years later, a new report by Lattice shows that only about 5% of these cryptocurrency and blockchain companies have actually ended up developing a product that has gained real market traction.¬†
The State Of Crypto Startups: Lots Of Funding, Little Traction
The recent report by Lattice, a crypto venture fund, shows that while crypto startups received massive funding over the past few years, most have failed to gain real traction or‚Ä¶

entry.title: Millionaire Crypto Influencer Found Dead And Dismembered In Argentina
entry.summary:
Missing crypto influencer Fernando P√©rez Algaba has been found dead, with his dismembered body found in a suitcase in Argentina.¬†
Scenes Surrounding The Crypto Influencer‚Äôs Death
According to a report from local news outlet La Nacion, this development comes days after Algaba disappeared. Local police said some kids were playing by a stream when they discovered the dismembered body of the crypto influencer in a red suitcase in the town of Ingeniero in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on July 23.¬†
Upon being informed by the children‚Äôs parents, the police arrived at the location and found the victim‚Äôs legs and forearm in the suitcase, along with four documents belonging to a family in the town Algaba was staying in. They also found another arm in the stream.¬†
Authorities later discovered Al‚Ä¶

entry.title: Canadian Regulator Proposes Changes to Its ‚ÄòCapital and Liquidity Approach to Crypto-Assets‚Äô
entry.summary:
The regulator of financial institutions in Canada said on July 26 that it had started the process of gathering the public‚Äôs view on proposals to change its ‚Äúcapital and liquidity approach to crypto-assets.‚Äù The draft guidelines are a response to the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision‚Äôs new banking standards for crypto-asset exposures.
Staying Abreast With International Developments
The Canadian regulator known as the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) announced on July 26 that it is ‚Äúproposing changes to its capital and liquidity approach to crypto-assets.‚Äù According to a statement, OSFI‚Äôs proposed new approach is intended ‚Äúto reflect an evolving risk environment and international developments.‚Äù
As per the statement, the Canadian regulator kickstarted ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Grayscale CLO Urges SEC: Green Light All Bitcoin Spot ETFs Now
entry.summary:
In a bid to pave the way for the much-anticipated era of spot Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs), Grayscale‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer, Craig Salm, has made a compelling case for the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to approve all spot ETF applications simultaneously. Grayscale‚Äôs legal team has submitted a letter regarding the recent eight spot ETF filings, arguing the SEC shouldn‚Äôt pick ‚Äúwinners and losers‚Äù.
Grayscale Calls For Bitcoin ETF Approval
Highlighting the interconnectedness between Bitcoin‚Äôs spot and futures markets, Salm argues, ‚ÄúThe SEC is already in a position to approve spot BTC ETFs based on its previous approval of Bitcoin futures ETFs. BTC‚Äôs spot and futures markets are inextricably linked (as evidenced by third-party studies showing 99% correlation).‚Äù This indic‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX and Genesis Global Strike Deal to Settle Bankruptcy Disputes
entry.summary: FTX and Genesis Global Capital have reached an agreement to resolve a dispute between the debtors of the now-bankrupt cryptocurrency companies. The agreement was disclosed in a letter that was filed by their lawyers in the US bankruptcy court for the Southern District of New York yesterday (Thursday). "The parties have reached an agreement in principle, subject to documentation, regarding a settlement that would resolve, among other things, the claims asserted by FTX's debtors against the debtors in these Chapter 11 cases and the claims asserted by Genesis' debtors against the FTX's debtors in the FTX's Chapter 11 cases," the letter noted. FTX's and Genesis's Claims Following the bankruptcy of FTX, Genesis emerged as the largest unsecured creditor of the cryptocurre‚Ä¶

entry.title: Roger Ver at Webx Asia: Reflections on Payments, Self-Custody, and the Role of Crypto Lawbreakers
entry.summary:
When asked whether he‚Äôd rather be called a ‚Äúbitcoin evangelist,‚Äù or ‚ÄúBitcoin Jesus‚Äù at the recent Webx seminar in Tokyo, Roger Ver responds: ‚ÄúI prefer to be called Roger.‚Äù The enthusiastic and outspoken figure in crypto, scattering sats around the world with unapologetic frankness about government, the bitcoin block size wars, and conflations of legality with morality, Roger Ver has been somewhat quiet in recent months. That notwithstanding, the early bitcoin investor had much to say about the state of crypto in Tokyo this week, talking payments, altcoins, FTX, and the role of literal outlaws in changing the world for the better.
‚ÄòI Am Not Satoshi Nakamoto‚Äô
Taking the stage at the Tokyo International Forum on Tuesday, pioneering Bitcoin investor Roger Ver reassured journalist Kazumoto ‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.
